remarks: Deduce a monoid from its properties.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Jan-2015.)
statement:
ismndd.b $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` G ) ) $.
ismndd.p $e |- ( ph -> .+ = ( +g ` G ) ) $.
ismndd.c $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B /\ y e. B ) -> ( x .+ y ) e. B ) $.
ismndd.a $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. B /\ z e. B ) ) -> ( ( x .+ y ) .+ z ) = ( x .+ ( y .+ z ) ) ) $.
ismndd.z $e |- ( ph -> .0. e. B ) $.
ismndd.i $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> ( .0. .+ x ) = x ) $.
ismndd.j $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> ( x .+ .0. ) = x ) $.
ismndd $p |- ( ph -> G e. Mnd ) $.
$d .0. x $.
$d B x y z $.
$d G x y z $.
$d ph x y z $.
